poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The nib flew backwards, fast, a bat Its wings as daggers flung at the blast of dark It banked and barrelled, backed up, backed up I bashed this out on brassed-off keys That barked and snapped at every serif Some brat, some bract of a garbage lily Branched across my window listened in The binary system blacked and blanked it Sorry officer this won't happen again.
